thread.title: Kendall Jenner reveals a surprising talent on James Corden's The Late Late Show
thread.title_full: Kendall Jenner reveals a surprising talent on James Corden's The Late Late Show

author: JJ Nattrass
title: Kendall Jenner reveals a surprising talent on James Corden's The Late Late Show
text:
Kendall Jenner reveals a surprising talent on James Corden's The Late Late Show The supermodel is actually a regular song-bird Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kendall Jenner reveals her hidden talent Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
She's part of a new generation of supermodels taking the fashion world by storm. 
And with a reality TV career and clothing label also in her stable it would seem that Kendal Jenner already has a serious amount of talent. 
However, the catwalk queen has been holding out on her admirers and fans, as she revealed a hidden talent on James Corden 's The Late Late Show, on Tuesday night. Read More James Corden reveals his nerves over Grammy Awards gig despite US chat show success What's your hidden talent? (Photo: CBS) 
Taking part in a skit for the opening segment of the show , the 21-year-old model lined-up alongside Andrew Garfield, Stevie Nicks and Taylor Lautner. 
Tasked with revealing a 'hidden' talent by James, who took on the role of a retro talent show host, the stars had to showcase their secret skills. 
Stepping out through a chintzy gold curtain, Kendall looked every inch the supermodel she is. Read More Khloe Kardashian 'relieved' about arrests over Kim's armed robbery - and glad it wasn't worse Kendall Jenner revealed she can chirp like a bird (Photo: CBS) 
Wearing a sheer black blouse which showcased her lithe and lean figure, and a pair of high-waisted black trousers teamed with towering black stilettos. 
The pretty model stepped out beside James who pretended she wasn't anyone special, asking her where she came from as well as her name. 
Introducing herself as "Kendall from Los Angeles", the Balmain beauty revealed she was going to be performing as bird song. She showcased the skills on James Corden's The Late Late Show (Photo: CBS) 
Parting her lips the model then made an astonishingly life-like bird chirp, which caused the audience to gasp and clap. 
Also wowing the studio was Spider-Man star Andrew, who showed that he's a regular Peter Parker in real-life by performing a back-flip. 
Stevie twirled a baton around, though unfortunately the rock icon hit herself in the head at the end of her routine. 
But, it was Taylor, who really impressed James, as he proceeded to catch grapes in his mouth from any distance and at any velocity. Like us on Facebook
